abstract: Colleague suspects police are behind disappearance of Chinese lawyer Zhang Kai, advocate for Christians in their dispute with Chinese government over display of church crosses; Amnesty International monitor of China says disappearance is likely part of ongoing government effort to silence dissident lawyers.
lead_paragraph: Zhang Kai and his assistant seemed to have disappeared on Tuesday night in Wenzhou, where they had gone to advise Protestant churches about the government’s recent demolition of crosses and church buildings.

headline.main: Lawyer Who Represented Churches in China Is Missing
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; China: Lawyer for Churches Is Missing

snippet: Zhang Kai and his assistant seemed to have disappeared on Tuesday night in Wenzhou, where they had gone to advise Protestant churches about the government’s recent demolition of crosses and church buildings.
